member.name: P:Mailr.Client.Options.TemplateFilePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the template file path.
member.value: The path to the template file passed via the /file command-line switch and used to generate email message body.

remarks.para: This command-line switch cannot be used in combination with the following switch(es): /dir, /name, /culture, /ext, and /format.

member.name: P:Mailr.Client.Options.TemplateDirPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the directory part of the template file path.
member.value: The path to the directory holding the template file passed via the /dir command-line switch. This folder will be used to generate path to the template file in the specified format.

remarks.para: This command-line switch cannot be used in combination with the /file switch.

member.name: P:Mailr.Client.Options.TemplateName
member.summary: Gets or sets the template name part of the template file path.
member.value: The base name of the template file passed via the /name command-line switch. This name will be used to generate path to the template file in the specified format.

remarks.para: This parameter should not include the culture (or language) as well as the file extension parts.
This command-line switch cannot be used in combination with the /file switch.

member.name: P:Mailr.Client.Options.TemplateCulture
member.summary: Gets or sets the culture or language code part of the template file path.
member.value:
The template localization culture or language code passed via the /culture command-line switch. This name will be used to generate path to the template file in the specified format. If this argument is not specified, the
may be used.

remarks.para: This command-line switch cannot be used in combination with the /file switch.

member.name: P:Mailr.Client.Options.TemplateExtension
member.summary: Gets or sets the file extension part of the template file path.
member.value:
The file extension passed via the /culture command-line switch. This extension will be used to generate path to the template file in the specified format. If this argument is not specified, the default
may be used.

remarks.para: This command-line switch cannot be used in combination with the /file switch.

member.name: P:Mailr.Client.Options.TemplateNameFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format string used to generate a localized template name.
member.value: The format string passed via the /format command-line switch. This format will be used to generate the file name part in the template file path. The format string must have three placeholders with indexes 0, 1, and 2 corresponding to the template name, culture/language code, and file extension respectively, e.g. {0}_{1}{2} which may result in the file name like Hello_en-us.html. If this argument is not specified, the default will be used (see additional details in the documentation).

remarks.para: This command-line switch cannot be used in combination with the /file switch.

member.name: P:Mailr.Client.Options.DataFilePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the data file path.
member.value: The path to the data file passed via the /data command-line switch and used to set up the substitution stings for template transformation.

remarks.para:
The data file must be a text file holding name=value pairs matching the placeholder names in the email template. Each data pair must be on a separate line:
Name=John Smith UnsubscribeID=467DAA31B9F941E99320C44644FFD104

member.name: T:Mailr.Client.Program
member.summary: Implements PRODUCTNAMEEXE, a command-line tool allowing you to test the library.

remarks.para: PRODUCTNAMEEXE sends email message generated from a localized email template file after applying transformations defined in a data file (the data file is a text file holding the name=value pairs that will be used for data transformations).
PRODUCTNAMEEXE is implemented as a single stand-alone executable with all dependencies, including PRODUCTNAMELIB, merged using ILMerge.
For additional information and usage examples, see the method description.
